message.content: We refer to the medication information for each option. Ethambutol is the carbohydrate polymerization inhibiting medication of the four listed, and a known side effect is vision loss. Cutaneous flushing is a side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet are a side effect of isoniazid, and arthralgias are a side effect of pyrazinamide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ethambutol is the carbohydrate polymerization inhibiting medication in the treatment of tuberculosis, and a known side effect is optic neuritis leading to vision loss. Cutaneous flushing is a side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet are side effects of isoniazid, and arthralgias are side effects of pyrazinamide.

We refer to the drug information for each of the options. Among the medications listed, ethambutol is the carbohydrate polymerization inhibiting medication. Its known side effect is vision loss, particularly changes in color perception or visual acuity. Cutaneous flushing is a known side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet are a known side effect of isoniazid, and arthralgias are a known side effect of pyrazinamide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The carbohydrate polymerization inhibiting medication is likely to be ethambutol, and it is associated with ocular toxicity, leading to vision loss. Cutaneous flushing is a side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet is a side effect of isoniazid, and arthralgias is a side effect of both isoniazid and pyrazinamide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, ethambutol is the carbohydrate polymerization inhibiting medication used in the treatment of tuberculosis. It is known to cause vision loss as a side effect, particularly affecting red-green color discrimination. Cutaneous flushing is a side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet are side effects of isoniazid, and arthralgias are side effects of pyrazinamide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ethambutol is the carbohydrate polymerization inhibiting medication in this regimen and a known side effect is vision loss, often presenting as a red-green color blindness. Cutaneous flushing is a side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet are a side effect of isoniazid, and arthralgias are a side effect of pyrazinamide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only ethambutol is a carbohydrate polymerization inhibitor, and it is known to potentially cause vision loss as a side effect. Cutaneous flushing is a side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet is a side effect of isoniazid, and arthralgias are a side effect of pyrazinamide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The carbohydrate polymerization inhibiting medication in this regimen is ethambutol. The known side effect of ethambutol is vision loss or optic neuropathy. Cutaneous flushing is a side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet is a side effect of isoniazid, and arthralgias is a common side effect of pyrazinamide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only ethambutol can cause vision loss, which is a known side effect. Cutaneous flushing and paresthesias of the hands and feet are side effects of isoniazid, while arthralgias are side effects of rifampin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ethambutol is the carbohydrate polymerization inhibitor in this medication regimen. Its known side effects include visual impairment and loss of color vision. Therefore, the correct answer is (C). Cutaneous flushing is a known side effect of rifampin, paresthesias of the hands and feet are known side effects of pyrazinamide, and arthralgias are known side effects of both isoniazid and pyrazinamide.
